sense.name: empty space
sense.commentary: An open or empty space between things, hole
sense.examples: There was a small opening between the trees. The explosion made an opening in the wall. The opening into the aorta from the lower left chamber of the heart is blocked. They left a small opening for the cat at the bottom of the door.

sense.name: opportunity
sense.commentary: Opportunity especially for employment or promotion, possibility
sense.examples: There is an opening in the sales department.

sense.name: step one
sense.commentary: An initial piece of something larger (sometimes the initial step in a series of actions)
sense.examples: The opening of the book established the basic theme. He memorized all of the important chess openings.

sense.name: beginning
sense.commentary: Something which begins a process or production (not a piece of something larger but an event in and of itself)
sense.examples: The opening ceremony was too long. The opening of his first play received critical reviews.

sense.name: becoming open
sense.commentary: OPENING[+event] The act of becoming open or being made open
sense.examples: The opening of his arms was the sign I was waiting for. The opening of the safe proved to be a difficult task. The ray of light revealed his cautious opening of the door.

sense.name: hatchway
sense.commentary: An entrance equipped with a hatch; especially a passageway between decks of a ship
sense.examples: He made it safely to the other deck of the ship via the hatchway or opening over there.
